intro: Stimoryne purpurea, commonly known as purple stimoryne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
